physical_appearance:This is a black-and-white photograph. It features two men speaking on stage. They are dressed in shite shirts and long trousers
 with the man on the left wearing a black tie. The man on the left is holding a long stick in his right hand
 and a microphone in his left hand. There is a white screen behind them on the top-left of the photograph. The photograph is overlapped by another photograph in the bottom-left corner. There are no tears or folds seen.

sgcool_label_text:George Lowe was a member of the British Expedition that saw Sir Edmund Hillary scale Mount Everest on 29 May 1953. In September that year
 Lowe accompanied Hillary on a visit to Singapore to deliver their first Everest lecture outside of New Zealand at the Odeon Theatre to an audience of 1
620 schoolchildren. This photograph album
 with the coat of arms of the City of Singapore in gilt on the cover
 was presented to Lowe as a souvenir of his visit.

metadata.title_text: Photograph album presented to George Lowe as a souvenir of his visit to Singapore George Lowe album: Photograph of Sir Edmund Hillary and George Lowe giving a presentation
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features two men speaking on stage. They are dressed in shite shirts and long trousers, with the man on the left wearing a black tie. The man on the left is holding a long stick in his right hand, and a microphone in his left hand. There is a white screen behind them on the top-left of the photograph. The photograph is overlapped by another photograph in the bottom-left corner. There are no tears or folds seen.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Photographs Photograph albums Souvenir Lowe, George, 1924-2013 Hillary, Edmund, 1919-2008 Lectures and lecture courses
metadata.sgcool_label_text: George Lowe was a member of the British Expedition that saw Sir Edmund Hillary scale Mount Everest on 29 May 1953. In September that year, Lowe accompanied Hillary on a visit to Singapore to deliver their first Everest lecture outside of New Zealand at the Odeon Theatre to an audience of 1,620 schoolchildren. This photograph album, with the coat of arms of the City of Singapore in gilt on the cover, was presented to Lowe as a souvenir of his visit.
